thread.title: Prince George headed to top London school in the fall | Page Six
thread.title_full: Prince George headed to top London school in the fall | Page Six

author: Emily Andrews, The Sun
title: Prince George headed to top London school in the fall | Page Six
text:
Prince George is going to one of London’s top private schools – Thomas’s Battersea – the Sun can reveal.
The third-in-line to the throne will start at the $7,978-a-term mixed prep in September.
The school, in south London, has 540 day pupils and is considered one of the best in the capital, boasting a new music school and sports facilities.
Kids start at age 4 and finish at either 11 or 13. And it tends to send them onto St Paul’s School, King’s Wimbledon or Wills’ old school Eton.
Former pupils include model Cara Delevingne and singer Florence Welch.
It had been previously reported that Kate Middleton , 35, would choose William’s former prep school Wetherby pre-prep in Notting Hill.
But it seems Kate and Wills wanted a different school for George.
Prince William and Kate Middleton with kids Prince George and Princess Charlotte Splash News Thomas’s also has a kindergarten on the same site, which Princess Charlotte , 22 months, is expected to attend.
In the Tatler School guide 2017, Mr. Thomas says: “The children are delightful – parents slightly less so.”
Prince George, 3, currently goes to the $41-a-day Montessori nursery in Westacre, Norfolk, close to the Cambridges’ Anmer Hall home.
Wills and Kate have said they are “moving back” to London – where their Kensington Palace apartment was renovated with $5.6 million taxpayers’ cash – so George can start school.
William has also said he’s stopping his part-time helicopter pilot job with East Ambulance to become a full-time royal.
  WhatsApp Email Copy This article originally appeared on The Sun .
